The House passed an election security bill.

Reauthorizing community health centers for the 27 million  who rely on them, Removing annual cap on therapy in Medicare, Allowing Alt. treatments for Vets, lowering Rx drug costs...are not just feel good measures. They, like all my bills, solve problems and help real people.

27 bills I authored became law between 2015 and 2018, alone.   http://Congress.gov  doesn't allow you to search for legislation that becomes law through the amendment process.  I just care that they get enacted and begin helping people.  Call my office for a full list.

My bill, the Ryan Kules Specially Adaptive Housing (SAH) Improvement Act, has passed the House. It expands SAH, which helps our most severely injured Vets, like Ryan, modify their homes for accessibility. Our bill provides  flexibility to meet the changing needs of participants. pic.twitter.com/k8rp7cph0e
As Co-Chair of the Congressional Hellenic Caucus,  I will continue to be a voice for justice for Cyprus.

Turkey must withdraw its nearly 40,000 troops from Cyprus, stop desecrating religious heritage sites such as churches and cemeteries,  account for the thousands of missing Cypriots, and negotiate in good faith for a just settlement of the division.
It is still impossible to fathom that 45 years later a NATO ally,  Turkey, can brutally invade and STILL occupy an EU member, Cyprus.  Nicosia is the world's only divided capital.

Erdogan’s Turkey has proven to be an unreliable ally. I’m pleased to see this Administration undertake what I’ve been advocating for in my Eastern Mediterranean Security and Energy Partnership Act. https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/trump-says-us-will-cancel-turkeys-purchase-of-russian-antimissile-system/2019/07/16/4921da04-a710-11e9-86dd-d7f0e60391e9_story.html?utm_term=.3e688d52e514 …

The spread of Hepatitis A has become a serious public health concern.  Talk to your doctor or contact your local health department to learn more about available vaccines that can prevent you from acquiring the illness.

Early and accurate diagnosis are often important factors for improving health outcomes.  My colleagues and I worked to increase federal investment in diagnostic quality and safety research. This research has the potential to save lives and improve care.. https://www.medpagetoday.com/publichealthpolicy/publichealth/81001 …
